name: Odes of Anacreon
description: Odes of Anacreon, translated by Thomas Moore

sections.name: Ode 1
sections.description: I saw the smiling bard of pleasure

sections.name: Ode 2
sections.description: Give me the harp of epic song

sections.name: Ode 3
sections.description: Listen to the Muse's lyre

sections.name: Ode 4
sections.description: Vulcan! hear your glorious task

sections.name: Ode 5
sections.description: Sculptor, wouldst thou glad my soul

sections.name: Ode 6
sections.description: As late I sought the spangled bowers

sections.name: Ode 7
sections.description: The women tell me every day

sections.name: Ode 8
sections.description: I care not for the idle state

sections.name: Ode 9
sections.description: I pray thee, by the gods above

sections.name: Ode 10
sections.description: How am I to punish thee

sections.name: Ode 11
sections.description: Tell me, gentle youth, I pray thee

sections.name: Ode 12
sections.description: They tell how Atys, wild with love

sections.name: Ode 13
sections.description: I will, I will; the conflict's past

sections.name: Ode 14
sections.description: Count me, on the summer trees

sections.name: Ode 15
sections.description: Tell me, why, my sweetest dove

sections.name: Ode 16
sections.description: Thou, whose soft and rosy hues

sections.name: Ode 17
sections.description: And now with all thy pencil's truth

sections.name: Ode 18
sections.description: Now the star of day is high

sections.name: Ode 19
sections.description: Here recline you, gentle maid

sections.name: Ode 20
sections.description: One day the Muses twined the hands

sections.name: Ode 21
sections.description: Observe when mother earth is dry

sections.name: Ode 22
sections.description: The Phrygian rock, that braves the storm

sections.name: Ode 23
sections.description: I often wish this languid lyre

sections.name: Ode 24
sections.description: To all that breathe the air of heaven

sections.name: Ode 25
sections.description: Once in each revolving year

sections.name: Ode 26
sections.description: Thy harp may sing of Troy's alarms

sections.name: Ode 27
sections.description: We read the flying courser's name

sections.name: Ode 28
sections.description: As, by his Lemnian forge's flame

sections.name: Ode 29
sections.description: Yes - loving is a painful thrill

sections.name: Ode 30
sections.description: Twas in a mocking dream of night

sections.name: Ode 31
sections.description: Arm'd with hyacinthine rod

sections.name: Ode 32
sections.description: Strew me a fragrant bed of leaves

sections.name: Ode 33
sections.description: Twas noon of night, when round the pole

sections.name: Ode 34
sections.description: Oh thou, of all creation blest

sections.name: Ode 35
sections.description: Cupid once upon a bed

sections.name: Ode 36
sections.description: If hoarded gold possess'd the power

sections.name: Ode 37
sections.description: Twas night, and many a circling bowl

sections.name: Ode 38
sections.description: Let us drain the nectar'd bowl

sections.name: Ode 39
sections.description: How I love the festive boy

sections.name: Ode 40
sections.description: I know that Heaven hath sent me here

sections.name: Ode 41
sections.description: When Spring adorns the dewy scene

sections.name: Ode 42
sections.description: Yes, be the glorious revel mine

sections.name: Ode 43
sections.description: While our rosy fillets shed

sections.name: Ode 44
sections.description: Buds of roses, virgin flowers

sections.name: Ode 45
sections.description: Within this goblet, rich and deep

sections.name: Ode 46
sections.description: Behold, the young, the rosy Spring

sections.name: Ode 47
sections.description: Tis true, my fading years decline

sections.name: Ode 48
sections.description: When my thirsty soul I steep

sections.name: Ode 49
sections.description: When Bacchus, Jove's immortal boy

sections.name: Ode 50
sections.description: When wine I quaff, before my eyes

sections.name: Ode 51
sections.description: Fly not thus my brow of snow
